action.action-desc: Mr. Posey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To create qualifications for, and certain limitations on, staffs of special counsels.

section.header: Qualifications and limitations on staffs of special counsels

subsection.text: This section applies with respect to any Federal officer or employee—

subparagraph.text: a special counsel appointed by the Attorney General under Department of Justice regulations; or
any other official appointed by the Attorney General who exercises a similar degree of independence from the normal Department of Justice chain of command; and

paragraph.text: whose investigation or prosecution involves an elected official.

subsection.header: Qualifications To work on the staff or advice

paragraph.text: It disqualifies a person for further advising or working on the staff of an officer or employee to whom this section applies that such person makes a contribution to a candidate for elective office or to a political party during such service.

paragraph.header: Statement under penalty of perjury required
paragraph.text: Before taking up the duties of working in the staff of an officer to whom this section applies, a person must sign, under penalty of perjury, a statement that such person has not made, within the 8-year period ending on the date such person begins such duties, a contribution to a candidate for elective office or to a political party.

subsection.header: Limitations on Federal employment after working on staff
subsection.text: A person who works on the staff of an official to whom this section applies shall not be employed, during the 5-year period after that person leaves the staff, in any Federal executive branch office or in a position within the civil service other than one within the competitive service in the Department of Justice—

paragraph.text: for which the compensation is determined under the General Schedule pursuant to title 5, United States Code, and any other law applicable to the salary levels set forth in that General Schedule; and
which the person held immediately prior to taking up duties working on the staff.
